Description: Terracotta mould-made relief-ware goblet fragment with a rounded body and tapering base. A central register, defined by horizontal ridges, depicts Bes flanked by pillars (inside a shrine?). A lower register depicts two vegetal fronds. The vessel was made in a two-piece mould, the join decorated with a vertical element edged on both side with angled toothing. The outer surface and part-way down the mouth inside are covered with an orange slip (10YR 8/4 -8/5). Fine orange-brown fabric (7.5YR 7/6).
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Great Temenos, South Mound 2019 N.I.2.22 Phase NW
Curator's comments: Close parallels from Naukratis (British Museum GR 1886,0401.1583; Boston, Museum of Fine Arts 88.905). A dancing Bes is found with other figures on a similar pot from the Hadra cemetery (Breccia 1912: pl. xii) and a pot from a Ptolemaic context at Naukratis was decorated with Bes standing (Leonard 1997: pl. 7:12, see also Seif el-Din 2006: pl. 41:2, from Alexandria). Similar, but large pots of this shape comes from Athribis, dated 2nd century BC (Myśliwiec 1994: 40, fig. 15; Myśliwiec 2004: 470–4), from Memphis, dated late Ptolemaic (Engelbach et al. 1915: pl. lxi:49 ; Grimm and Johannes 1975: pl. 105) and some fragments of similar type are illustrated in Pagenstecher (1913: 71). A similar figure of Bes dancing was dated late Hellenistic (Fjeldhagen 1995: no. 58), whilst a relief figure of Isis, seated in a shrine, and holding up a sistrum and a pot, flanked by dancing Bes figures, was found in the Fayum, but dated first half of the 2nd century AD (von Falck and Lichtwark 1996: 151, no. 116; Bayer-Niemeier 1988: no. 225). identical and probably from same vessel as Boston MFA 88.905. A similar ware is published by Bailey as part of an Alexandria produced group of goblets, amphorae and other forms dating to the 2nd century BC, found at Alexandria and Naukratis (Bailey 2011, 71-93: Goblet 1A 74-77, pls 2-8; Goblet 1B 77- 81 pls9-11; Goblet 1C 81-82, pl. 11; Table Amphora 2 82-84, pls 12-15; other form 84-85 pl. 15).
